answers.author: Caitlyn Mitchell
answers.text:
LA County has established such commission. It was formed in 1969 in order to better work with munipal unions. Here is a link to its home page:
http://bos.co.la.ca.us/categories/ExecOffice/EmployeeRelationsComm.htm
Here is the home page for the state New Jersey's Public Employee Relations Commission:
http://www.state.nj.us/perc/
Here is Wisconsin's version:
http://werc.wi.gov/
Here is Washington's version:
http://www.perc.wa.gov/
Here is Oregon's:
http://www.oregon.gov/ERB/index.shtml
There are a bunch of state examples if you google "public employee relations committee/commission. These homepages are fairly extensive. They offer mission statements, past records, contracts ect. Hope it helps.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is interested in receiving information from local governments’ that have established "employee relations commission" or committees.  Specifically, they are looking for is a formal body that brings a subcommittee of elected officials together with staff to discuss issues.  
If you have a committee/group such as this or similar, please forward any information or documentation you may have that describes how the committee/group was established, polices, administrative directives, etc.
Your time and expertise is appreciated!
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
pmuse@transformgov.org
